DOC.brief_summary: The aim study assess safety efficacy Multi-LOC® peripheral stent system treat de novo restenotic lesion ( in-stent restenosis ( ISR ) , restenosis post drug coat balloon ( DCB ) flow limit plain old balloon angioplasty ( POBA ) and/or DCB dilatation superficial femoral artery ( SFA ) popliteal segment ( P1 , P2 & P3 )
DOC.brief_title: `` All Comers '' Post Market Clinical Follow-up ( PMCF ) With Multi-LOC flOw liMiting Outcomes ( LOCOMOTIVE Extended )
DOC.detailed_description: This study non-randomized , prospective , multi-center , non-interventional study ( registry , Germany : §23b MPG )
DOC.criteria: Willingness treat flowlimiting dissections/recoil plain old balloon angioplasty ( POBA ) /drug coat balloon ( DCB ) intervention Patients Rutherford class 2 5 Patients eligible peripheral revascularization mean percutaneous transluminal angioplasty ( PTA ) stenting Patients must least 18 year age Patient life expectance least 12 month Patients mentally linguistically able understand aim study show sufficient compliance follow study protocol Patients must agree undergo least 6month clinical followup Patient able verbally acknowledge understand associate risk , benefit , treatment alternative therapeutic option trial , e.g . balloon angioplasty mean suitable stent device . Patients , provide informed consent , agree risk benefit state patient inform consent document . Lesions unsatisfying angiographic result due recoil and/or dissection POBA/DCB intervention Infrainguinal lesion superficial femoral artery ( SFA ) popliteal segment ( P1 , P2 & P3 ) reference vessel diameter 4 7.0 mm , lesion length suitable release least 2 Stent ( 6 ) segment implant minimum interstent distance 1 cm Diameter stenosis preprocedure must large equal 70 % Vessels must adequate distal runoff least one vessel foot collateral calf supply sufficient flow foot . ( Lesions separate less 2 cm consider one lesion ) Patient suitable revascularization interventional mean
